text: the alpha dog nest is something that I
really hate the idea that you have to be
the Alpha sort of dominant over your dog
in order to for the household to run
well and this comes from this old
research with wolves with captive wolves
that showed that in an enclosed
population of young male wolf they
establish a dominance hierarchy and
there was an alpha where the alpha eats
first the Alpha gets to mate first as
any female is there and so forth but
that's not how dogs are you know that's
how captive wolves in a small enclosure
are that's not even how wolves are in
their natural environment they live in
family packs if their alphas their
parents you know they eat first because
they've hunted the food but they bring
it back to the group it just creates a
whole mythology about how you should
treat your dogs to say that you have to
be dominant over your dogs you can be if
you want to shout and scream at your dog
wow you'll have a scared dog who will
probably listen to you but that's not a
great relationship and it's not fair to
the dog so I think a better thing to do
is to realize actually they're just a
member of our family of our past and I
think we owe them as great companions at
least thinking about what their point of
view is
